availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Walter P. Ingram (Pulaski County merchant, soldier, Hall's Gap Battalion)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, merchant. Married to Sultana Ingram. Father of John C. Ingram, Melinda M. Ingram, and Robert W. Ingram. Merchant in Somerset in 1860. Served in Hallâ€™s Gap Battalion as private from February 10th, 1865, to March 15, 1865; 1st Lieutenant from March 15, 1865, to May 1, 1865; and captain from May 1, 1865, to July 27, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, District 1, p. 236.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Buncombe District, p. 168A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 796-97, 958.
Headstones Provided for Deceased Union Civil War Veterans, 1861-1904 NARA Record Group 92, Records of the Office of the Quartermaster General Series Number: M1845, May 6, 1882.
